subject: CBS NEWS Sunday Morning: Changing nature of breakfast
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






May 4, 2007
 
What’s for 
      breakfast this Sunday?


If 
      you’re like millions of Sunday 
      Morning viewers, perhaps you’ll be having some 
      coffee, a little OJ, maybe a 
      little cereal, along with a hefty portion of Charles Osgood. But American 
      eating habits have changed, and our breakfast meal isn’t exactly what it 
      used to be. Our Cynthia Bowers will be looking into what’s for 
      breakfast in our Cover Story this week.
Summer’s just around the 
      corner and, this weekend, we launch our summer preview series with 
      Jerry Bowen’s look at what’s hot at the movies. There’s a lot more 
      than "Spider-Man 3" coming to a 
      theater near you.
From 
      Rita Braver this Sunday, a conversation with White House press secretary 
      Tony Snow. Snow is just back on the job after disclosing he’s being 
      treated for cancer. He talks with Braver about grappling with illness, 
      while remaining at work on the job he loves. 
You 
      may not have heard about the Texas swing 
      group Asleep at the 
      Wheel. Suffice it to say that there’s nothing sleepy about 
      them, as you’ll see, and hear, from Mark Strassmann this 
      week.

Nancy 
      Giles sounds off on us, the 
      media – what we cover, and why.  And then, we’re off to the wild blue yonder, made wilder still, Bill Geist tells 
      us, after last weekend’s rocket launch that carried the remains of some 
      200 earthlings into space.

Those 
      stories, and more, this Sunday 
      Morning.
Listen for our trumpet!
